GOD.content: adieu: 1) salutation, hello, “I can see you” 2) a goodbye 3) à-dieu, relation to God, every relation to other would be à-dieu
GOD.linkedContent: adieu: 1) salutation, hello, “I can see you” 2) a goodbye 3) à-dieu, relation to God, every relation to other would be à-dieu

GOD.content: to think responsibility w/in criteria of salvation, the Good as infinite love, the gift of death, requires event of Christianity, or makes Christianity possible
GOD.linkedContent: to think responsibility w/in criteria of salvation, the Good as infinite love, the gift of death, requires event of Christianity, or makes Christianity possible

MONL.content: power this ‘alien’ [Oedipus] holds over ‘aliens’: innermost secret, sepulture, in exchange for salvation of city, which he refuses his daughters (refuses them a just ‘work of mourning’)
MONL.linkedContent: power this ‘alien’ [Oedipus] holds over ‘aliens’: innermost secret, sepulture, in exchange for salvation of city, which he refuses his daughters (refuses them a just ‘work of mourning’)

R.content: both Plato & Aristotle maintain political turn toward or salutation of One God, where arkhē has at his disposal tekhnē, for Plato not utopia, prayer, but very difficult
R.linkedContent: both Plato & Aristotle maintain political turn toward or salutation of One God, where arkhē has at his disposal tekhnē, for Plato not utopia, prayer, but very difficult

R.content: Heidegger: “only a God can save us (Nur noch ein Gott kann uns retten)”; Derrida observes communication in Heidegger btwn retten (to save), das Heilen (the Unscathed, the safe, the sound), and das Freie (free, also, save, preserve, immunity) > in tact, untouched, purify
R.linkedContent: Heidegger: “only a God can save us (Nur noch ein Gott kann uns retten)”; Derrida observes communication in Heidegger btwn retten (to save), das Heilen (the Unscathed, the safe, the sound), and das Freie (free, also, save, preserve, immunity) > in tact, untouched, purify

R.content: salut: safe, salvation, welcome, farewell; salut: retten, heilen, grüssen > btwn salvation and salute to the other
R.linkedContent: salut: safe, salvation, welcome, farewell; salut: retten, heilen, grüssen > btwn salvation and salute to the other

R.content: only a God w/out sovereignty can save us? nothing is less sure, that is why we are talking, and what we are talking about [also re: democracy]; “democracy to come—salut!”
R.linkedContent: only a God w/out sovereignty can save us? nothing is less sure, that is why we are talking, and what we are talking about [also re: democracy]; “democracy to come—salut!”

AF.content: Freud dreams irreplaceable place, the very ash, condition of singularity, idiom, secret, testimony, trace no longer distinguishes itself from substrate > absolutely safe location
AF.linkedContent: Freud dreams irreplaceable place, the very ash, condition of singularity, idiom, secret, testimony, trace no longer distinguishes itself from substrate > absolutely safe location

HERP.content: Heidegger on “the few” [poets, philosophers…] the few who tried to save sofon from (contre) the Sophists, from men of marketplace, “to save and protect (retten und schützen)”
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger on “the few” [poets, philosophers…] the few who tried to save sofon from (contre) the Sophists, from men of marketplace, “to save and protect (retten und schützen)”

PP.content: Socrates give[s] myths a send off (envoyer promener les mythes), les saluer, dismisses them, cette belle résolution du khairein [Phaedrus (230a) Socrates says goodbye to myths, because he does not even know himself], khairein in name of truth, self-knowledge, autoscopy, autognosis
PP.linkedContent: Socrates give[s] myths a send off (envoyer promener les mythes), les saluer, dismisses them, cette belle résolution du khairein [Phaedrus (230a) Socrates says goodbye to myths, because he does not even know himself], khairein in name of truth, self-knowledge, autoscopy, autognosis

PP.content: Derrida treats this send off, in a dialogue w/ 2 rigorously original myths [cicada, Theuth], as a welcoming of myths > both myths invented after question of writing
PP.linkedContent: Derrida treats this send off, in a dialogue w/ 2 rigorously original myths [cicada, Theuth], as a welcoming of myths > both myths invented after question of writing

PP.content: Socrates turns pharmakon, hemlock, through logos, into salvation, deliverance
PP.linkedContent: Socrates turns pharmakon, hemlock, through logos, into salvation, deliverance

PAS.content: Blanchot’s récit as new thought of citation acc. EROS, repetition of yes that begins by doubling itself, récit unscathed, unique force of a viens that never reproduces itself: viens —sauf
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot’s récit as new thought of citation acc. EROS, repetition of yes that begins by doubling itself, récit unscathed, unique force of a viens that never reproduces itself: viens —sauf

PAS.content: Viens, at the same time unique and copy (exemplaire), Blanchot’s récits as exemplary citations, their unique power is that the unscathed possibility of unique (le sauf) remains in reserve from which “I would emerge” to say, to one of them,“Viens”
PAS.linkedContent: Viens, at the same time unique and copy (exemplaire), Blanchot’s récits as exemplary citations, their unique power is that the unscathed possibility of unique (le sauf) remains in reserve from which “I would emerge” to say, to one of them,“Viens”

PAS.content: to save those drowning, lui donnant plutôt la parole, le sauf
PAS.linkedContent: to save those drowning, lui donnant plutôt la parole, le sauf

PAS.content: what does sauf mean? save them from an outside not even proper to them? sauf: secret (dérobé), powerful word, language fascinates starting form it > like sans, pas: crumbles, precludes the set from understanding itself: “rien sauf le dehors” > sauvetage project part of writing project
PAS.linkedContent: what does sauf mean? save them from an outside not even proper to them? sauf: secret (dérobé), powerful word, language fascinates starting form it > like sans, pas: crumbles, precludes the set from understanding itself: “rien sauf le dehors” > sauvetage project part of writing project

PAS.content: assimilating interiority of mastery can also be terrible thus compulsion toward outside could be defense > sauf le dehors, tout sauf le dehors
PAS.linkedContent: assimilating interiority of mastery can also be terrible thus compulsion toward outside could be defense > sauf le dehors, tout sauf le dehors

PAS.content: sans remarks same X w/out annulling it, springless spring (ce ressort sans ressort), this re-trait leaves everything intact (sauf, indemne) in appearance [absolute heterogenous neutrality w/out negation], at the same time it has abducted, erased, absolute rapidity of dispossession (dérapage)
PAS.linkedContent: sans remarks same X w/out annulling it, springless spring (ce ressort sans ressort), this re-trait leaves everything intact (sauf, indemne) in appearance [absolute heterogenous neutrality w/out negation], at the same time it has abducted, erased, absolute rapidity of dispossession (dérapage)

PAS.content: the inner rhythm of sauf (contamination), always altered, always unscathed, “j’ai tout, sauf…” > “sauf que je voudrais en être débarrassé”
PAS.linkedContent: the inner rhythm of sauf (contamination), always altered, always unscathed, “j’ai tout, sauf…” > “sauf que je voudrais en être débarrassé”

S.content: promise (Versprechen) announces, salutes, what has already taken place “before” (this is the temporality of the coming of the event, Ereignis or Geschehen), it is the dissymmetry of a yes before opposition of yes and no, before question, language always revient à de la promesse
S.linkedContent: promise (Versprechen) announces, salutes, what has already taken place “before” (this is the temporality of the coming of the event, Ereignis or Geschehen), it is the dissymmetry of a yes before opposition of yes and no, before question, language always revient à de la promesse

S.content: acc. Heidegger, there’s a “must” a “we must think” of the promise, thought as fidelity to promise > must hear & obey
S.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, there’s a “must” a “we must think” of the promise, thought as fidelity to promise > must hear & obey

S.content: Heidegger’s resurrection to come of Menschenschlag [a third blow?], blow which saves (rettet), hymn to archi-originary, yet-to-come event, what poet sings
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s resurrection to come of Menschenschlag [a third blow?], blow which saves (rettet), hymn to archi-originary, yet-to-come event, what poet sings

FWT.content: [re: contradictory reaffirmation] passive reception, decision to say “yes,” then selection, interpretation, thus transformation: not to leave safe the very thing one respects before all else > not to leave safe: to save it, perhaps, yet again, w/out illusion of final salvation
FWT.linkedContent: [re: contradictory reaffirmation] passive reception, decision to say “yes,” then selection, interpretation, thus transformation: not to leave safe the very thing one respects before all else > not to leave safe: to save it, perhaps, yet again, w/out illusion of final salvation

PS.content: for Artaud, soteriology will be the eschatology of one’s proper body: “state…of my body…will make the Last Judgment” [when body is upright w/out detritus, w/out the work]
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, soteriology will be the eschatology of one’s proper body: “state…of my body…will make the Last Judgment” [when body is upright w/out detritus, w/out the work]

DPi.content: depth of desire of deconstruction: deconstruct death, perhaps > but it is not enough to deconstruct death to ensure salvation [Derrida’s multiple angels speaking to him]
DPi.linkedContent: depth of desire of deconstruction: deconstruct death, perhaps > but it is not enough to deconstruct death to ensure salvation [Derrida’s multiple angels speaking to him]

TB.content: Babel as metaphor of metaphor, narrative of narrative, translation of translation: not only structure hollowing itself out like that, but does so in its own way > its idiom would have to be saved
TB.linkedContent: Babel as metaphor of metaphor, narrative of narrative, translation of translation: not only structure hollowing itself out like that, but does so in its own way > its idiom would have to be saved

RGE.content: in order to save what does not want to be saved (silence, play, absolute risk), must redouble language, must have recourse to strategies, ruses, simulacra, masks
RGE.linkedContent: in order to save what does not want to be saved (silence, play, absolute risk), must redouble language, must have recourse to strategies, ruses, simulacra, masks

RM.content: always plus d’une language in the language: the capture of the crossing (croisement) that allies Ziehen and Reissen, this capture (à la fois violent/faithful, laissant sauf) affects the captor, abduction (captation), translation, into other’s language [French retrait, English re-tracing] > all this already at work (à l’oeuvre) in the other’s languages, these dealings make for a work (fait oeuvre)
RM.linkedContent: always plus d’une language in the language: the capture of the crossing (croisement) that allies Ziehen and Reissen, this capture (à la fois violent/faithful, laissant sauf) affects the captor, abduction (captation), translation, into other’s language [French retrait, English re-tracing] > all this already at work (à l’oeuvre) in the other’s languages, these dealings make for a work (fait oeuvre)

PSSS.content: “it’s not going well,” a redemptive concern—necessity to save: salutary, sanitary, immunitary concern > also, a gesture of war: militant saves by routing a resistance: French Revolution’s terror, Comité de Salut Public
PSSS.linkedContent: “it’s not going well,” a redemptive concern—necessity to save: salutary, sanitary, immunitary concern > also, a gesture of war: militant saves by routing a resistance: French Revolution’s terror, Comité de Salut Public

PSSS.content: who’s to say our republic is still not monarchical, that instead of a paregicide, the king’s neck was saved, erected by decapitation; never know if States General, at moment of first convocation, condemned or saved king’s head > both gestures indissociable
PSSS.linkedContent: who’s to say our republic is still not monarchical, that instead of a paregicide, the king’s neck was saved, erected by decapitation; never know if States General, at moment of first convocation, condemned or saved king’s head > both gestures indissociable

PSSS.content: condemning/saving inscribe in concepts sovereignty & cruelty an ambiguity as unrelievable as autoimmunity itself: in any paregicide, any Oedipus, any totem + taboo, any republican or democratic installation of brothers, no way to know whether paregicide took place or not, took place w/out taking place, before any question about it [see HYMEN]
PSSS.linkedContent: condemning/saving inscribe in concepts sovereignty & cruelty an ambiguity as unrelievable as autoimmunity itself: in any paregicide, any Oedipus, any totem + taboo, any republican or democratic installation of brothers, no way to know whether paregicide took place or not, took place w/out taking place, before any question about it [see HYMEN]

TN.content: Gospel as a general haptics, flesh that is touching–touched > “le salut sauve en touchant, et le sauveur, à savoir le touchant, est aussi touché: sauvé, sauf, indemne—touché par la grâce” > touching, purify, heal, save, extend hand [heal blindness by touching eyes = touch before sight]
TN.linkedContent: Gospel as a general haptics, flesh that is touching–touched > “le salut sauve en touchant, et le sauveur, à savoir le touchant, est aussi touché: sauvé, sauf, indemne—touché par la grâce” > touching, purify, heal, save, extend hand [heal blindness by touching eyes = touch before sight]

TN.content: Jesus in pity (misertus/splagchnistheis)—he was moved, touched, his bleeding heart moves him to touch
TN.linkedContent: Jesus in pity (misertus/splagchnistheis)—he was moved, touched, his bleeding heart moves him to touch

TN.content: origin of fetishism [?], desire to touch what touches Jesus’ body (garments), touching w/out touching > made safe, immune, by faith of what touch signifies (not by touch itself)
TN.linkedContent: origin of fetishism [?], desire to touch what touches Jesus’ body (garments), touching w/out touching > made safe, immune, by faith of what touch signifies (not by touch itself)

TN.content: history of untouchable: immune, sound, safe, “sauf—le toucher”
TN.linkedContent: history of untouchable: immune, sound, safe, “sauf—le toucher”

TN.content: Derrida poking fun at himself, how he’s abstaining from touching Nancy, claiming touch is impossible–prohibited, and we love to call this loving—abstaining, like the Messiah
TN.linkedContent: Derrida poking fun at himself, how he’s abstaining from touching Nancy, claiming touch is impossible–prohibited, and we love to call this loving—abstaining, like the Messiah

TN.content: [more on (im)possibility of deconstructing Christianity] salvation from Christianity is a Christian value: Bataille’s hyperbolic mask, what he sometimes called his “hyper-Christianity”
TN.linkedContent: [more on (im)possibility of deconstructing Christianity] salvation from Christianity is a Christian value: Bataille’s hyperbolic mask, what he sometimes called his “hyper-Christianity”

TN.content: singularity [never assured] doit être couru comme une chance ou un risque: Nancy’s a bettor, thinker of the bet (pari), a desperate bettor, never stops staking, committing (d’engager), calculating w/ exactitude hyperbolic odds (gages): not counting on gains (bénéfice) of an “argument du pari” [Pascal] or any salut
TN.linkedContent: singularity [never assured] doit être couru comme une chance ou un risque: Nancy’s a bettor, thinker of the bet (pari), a desperate bettor, never stops staking, committing (d’engager), calculating w/ exactitude hyperbolic odds (gages): not counting on gains (bénéfice) of an “argument du pari” [Pascal] or any salut

TN.content: “consentement exaspéré,” un salut exespéré (ex-hoped for salvation), un salut juste à venir (a just salut to come, a salut just on its way…), un salut sans salvation, worthy of the name
TN.linkedContent: “consentement exaspéré,” un salut exespéré (ex-hoped for salvation), un salut juste à venir (a just salut to come, a salut just on its way…), un salut sans salvation, worthy of the name

AD.content: for Levinas, religious salvation (vertical), human dwelling (horizontal)

OG.content: writing/double opens desire and re-gardent la jouissance—Rousseau searches for un salut (haven) dans l’écriture
OG.linkedContent: writing/double opens desire and re-gardent la jouissance—Rousseau searches for un salut (haven) dans l’écriture
